_meanings:
{@--1@} Reverential 
salutation, respectful obeisance, 
salutation of a superior or elder by an
inferior or junior, or of a teacher
by his disciple. It consists in (1)
rising from one's seat ({#pratyuttTAna#}),
(2) seizing the feet ({#pAdopasaMgraha#}), and
(3) repeating the form of 
salutation ({#aBivAda#}) which includes the
name or title of the person 
addressed, followed by the 
mention of the person's own name.
For the different ways of 
performing obeisance and the merit arising
therefrom see <ls>Ms. 2. 120-126</ls>.
